MLE best fits with 1-sparse constraint¶

MLE estimation from a datacube, assuming the signals are 1-sparse.

author:Jean-Baptiste Courbot - jean-baptiste.courbot@univ-lyon1.fr
date:november 18 2015
mle_sparse_est.get_moments(im_ind_est, im_weight_est, D, W, pas, pas_spectral)[source]¶

Calculate the 0,1,2 moments from indices arrays

Parameters:
  • im_ind_est (ndarray) – estimated indices array. Shape:(spatial,spatial).
  • im_weight_est (ndarray) – corresponding weights. Shape: (spatial,spatial).
  • D (ndarray) – Dictionary used for MLE fits.
  • W (int) – spectra length.
  • pas (float) – width sampling used for the dictionnary creation.
  • pas_spectral (float) – Angstrom/bandwidth.
mle_sparse_est.get_sparse_estimate(Y, F, D)[source]¶

Calculate the best-fit dictionnary indices.

Parameters:
  • Y (ndarray) – Hyperspectral, multiple observation datacube. Shape: (spatial,spatial,spectral,observation).
  • F (ndarray) – Field Spread Function, windowed in a square.
  • D (ndarray) – Dictionary to use for MLE fits.
mle_sparse_est.mle_sparse_estimate(liste_vec, D_3d_unip)[source]¶

Maximum Likelihood estimations for the provided vectors, under a 1-sparse assumption. This function will be used in the ML estimation add-on.

Parameters:
  • liste_vec (ndarray) – hyperspectral datacube arranged to form an array. Shape: (spatial*spatial, spectral).
  • D_3d_unip (ndarray) – dictionary, considering spatial (FSF-weighted-) neighborhood, evaluated on 1 observation.
